title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist, the file is marked as changed even though it remains unchanged.
OB: After using code assist (CtrlSpace), the Java file is marked as 'dirtied' or 'changed' even though there are no modifications made to the file.
EB: The expected behavior is that the file should not be marked as changed or dirtied by code assist if no actual modifications have been made to the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call, for example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
3. Press CtrlSpace.
